result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Treatment Court
from Atty Walker re:  rescinding of demand for speedy trial.

ALONG WITH $13,000.00 CO-SIGNATURE BOND WITH FATHER, RICHARD HOEFT, DOB 4/4/48 AND MOTHER CHRISTINE HOEFT, 3/15/49 - BOTH MUST HAVE PHOTO ID. Cts 1 & 2: 943.201(2)(a)-Misapprop ID/Info-Obtain money; Cts 3 & 4: 943.38(2)-Forgery-Uttering.  Conditions:  No contact with the victim, DH (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED BOND TO INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS: Must be transported to the Salvation Army program IMMEDIATELY upon release. If a bed is no longer available, this bond is void. The program must be in-patient and when it becomes outpatient, the deft must notify the Court w/in 12 hours. The defendant must sign a medical release allowing the State and the Court. If that release is not signed or is revoked at any time, this bond is also revoked

Defendant Nicholas D Hoeft in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Nicholas D Hoeft in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense provides documentation to the Court as requested. Defense is asking for a signature bond to allow deft to go directly to the treatment facility. The State did not receive the information on the program prior to the hearing and takes a moment for review. The Court conducts a colloquy with Christine Hoeft 3/15/49, mother of deft, and Richard A Hoeft, 4/4/48 are willing to co-sign bond for the defendant along with her husband. The State notes that a potential co-signer is also a victim and feels that is inappropriate.

BTC: The Court will modify bond $2000.00 cash plus balance co-signature with both parents. Must be transported to the Salvation Army program IMMEDIATELY upon release. If a bed is no longer available, this bond is void. The program must be in-patient and when it becomes outpatient, the deft must notify the Court w/in 12 hours. The defendant must sign a medical release allowing the State and the Court. If that release is not signed or is revoked at any time, this bond is also revoked. All other terms and conditions remain.

Defendant Nicholas D Hoeft in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Nicholas D Hoeft in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense requests bonds in all three cases be reduced to allow defendant to obtain treatment. Defense indicates deft has treatment set up through Agape through his church. Treatment can begin immediately. The State agrees that the deft has a treatment need but the State is not familiar with the Agape program and the State wants more information as to what their methodology is and where the deft will live and who will be responsible for keeping an eye on the deft.

BTC: Bond modification is held in abeyance until next week to allow time to get information on the program  Status conference scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.
For bond reduction
